Design ideas

Source: design.md

Preparing for version 1.0

General thoughts

  • CF objects reference an NCVariable only when they are backed by a file. Basic NC properties (name, unlim, what else?) are copied into CF objects and synched from NC to CF but not the other way around (multiple CFs could reference a single NC)
  • CF objects do not follow NC group hierarchy. How to find CF objects? CFDataset mimics group hierarchy for CF objects
  • Reading from / writing to file is always through the NCVariable. The CF object holds start / count vectors.
  • CF objects have small set of publically exposed methods, everything else is private. Access to properties is through active bindings, exclusively
  • Every CF object is self-contained and defines its own methods to execute operations such as subsetting or copying.
  • Merge CFVariableBase, CFArray, CFVariable into CFVariable. CFVariable can be just metadata or have data loaded.
  • CFShape: axes and CRS. Take count of references from CFVariables?
  • CFBounds a full-scale CF object with a NC reference
  • Incorporate CFtime?

NC objects

NCDimension, NCVariable, NCGroup, and NCUDT map directly to objects in the netCDF resource. All inherit from NCObject. This is largely the same as in version 0.

CFObject

The basic ancestor of all CF objects.

Properties
  • id: The id of the NCVariable it links to, or a negative value if no NCVariable is linked. This property is read-only to the user of the package.
  • name: A character string that conforms to CF naming rules. Upon reading an existing netCDF resource, its value is taken from the NCVariable this object links to. It may be modified by the user.
  • nc: The NCVariable that this object links to, or NULL if the object exists only in memory. Read-only for the user, but may be updated programmatically after writing the CF object to file.
Methods
